text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company

Transport Secretary Sir George Young has crossed swords with Peter Ford, London underground chairman and Dennis Tunnicliffe, managing director, over the six months delay on the Jubilee line extension schedule. Sir George has cancelled an announcement on the matter; his advisers have judged that the delay could be far longer.

Andersen Consulting, the premier management and technology consultancy, today posted another record year for revenues. Rumours continue to abound over the notion that its sister accounting company Arthur Andersen may be floated off.
MARKETS HOLD THEIR BREATH OVER GREENSPAN
With Chairman of the Federal Reserve Alan Greenspan about to deliver the second part of his Humphrey Hawkins testimony to Congress, US markets were steeling themselves for another equity bashing.
EGYPT'S HOT MARKET SLOWED BY GLITCHES

Egypt, one of the hottest emerging markets, is being hampered by administrative problems. In six months, daily trading volume has jumped by more than 200 percent, whilst a lack of skilled clerks has meant that there is a growing number of unsettled deals.
